intro: Fissendocarpa linifolia, commonly known as the slender-leaved fissendocarp, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to eastern Australia, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and understoreys. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Fissendocarpa linifolia plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food and shelter for various native wildlife species.
